name: nurture
content:
nurture verb [T]
(HELP DEVELOP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to take care of, feed, and protect someone or something, especially young children or plants, and help him, her, or it to develop: She wants to stay at home and nurture her children. a carefully nurtured garden
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to take care of someone or somethingcare forShe had to give up her job to care for her elderly mother.take care ofI just want to make enough money to take care of my family. look afterMy aunt looked after me after my parents died.nurseHe nursed me back to health.tendHe lived a quiet life, tending his garden and his hives.
See more results »
to help a plan or a person to develop and be successful: As a record company executive, his job is to nurture young talent.

(FOR A LONG TIME)
